alert.note: Alert for Calhoun (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 11:47AM EST until December 17 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Calhoun, Fairfield, Kershaw, Lexington, Newberry, Richland and Saluda. * WHEN...Until 245 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1145 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the area. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas may cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain has fallen. An additional 1 to 1.5 inches of rain is possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Batesburg-Leesville, Springdale, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, Oak Grove, St. Andrews, Red Bank, Dentsville, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, Gaston, Elgin, Arcadia Lakes, Ridge Spring and Harbison State Forest. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 26 between mile markers 91 and 123. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 41 and 86. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 30. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown.
